Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.status in FHIR.  (en)

at0073.description: *The existence of the study is registered, but no result is yet available. (en)

at0074.description: *This is a partial (e.g. initial, interim or preliminary) result but data may be incomplete or unverified. (en)

at0075.description: Verified early results are available, but not all results are final. This is a sub-category of 'Partial'.

at0076.description: *The result is complete and verified by an authorised person. (en)

at0077.description: *Subsequent to being final, the result has been modified. (en)

at0078.description: *Subsequent to being final, the result has been modified to correct an error. This is a sub-category of 'Amended'. (en)

at0079.description: *Subsequent to being final, the result has been modified by adding new content. The existing content is unchanged. This is a sub-category of 'Amended'. (en)

at0080.description: The result is unavailable because the test was not started or not completed (also sometimes called 'aborted').

at0083.description: *Details of additional clinicians or organisations who require a copy of the examination result. (en)
at0083.comment: The 'Distribution list' is for information-only, and that the primary recipient of the report is the person intended to act on the information.

at0087.description: *Name of the radiological procedure used to capture the study. (en)
at0087.comment: *Coding of the 'Technique' with a terminology is permitted. Multiple occurrences allow for identification of one or more techniques. (en)

at0088.description: *Identification of the clinical procedure or management used to capture the study. (en)

at0090.description: *The status of the result is not known. (en)

at0091.description: *The type of imaging device, process or method that originally acquired or produced the data used to create the images in the study. (en)
at0091.comment: *For example: 'XRay', 'CT scan', 'ultrasound', 'MRI', 'bone densitometry', 'tomography', 'mammography', 'nuclear medicine', 'PET', 'angiography', and 'fluoroscopy'. This data element may be redundant if the modality is clearly represented in the 'Study name'. Alternatively it may also be possible to autopopulate the 'Modality' from a coded 'Study name'. Coding of the 'Modality' with a value set is recommended, such as the DICOM CID 29 Acquisition Modality value set. Equivalent to ImagingStudy.modality in FHIR and Modality (0008, 0060) in DICOM. (en)

at0092.description: *Unique identifier for the imaging study assigned by the imaging device. (en)
at0092.comment: *Equivalent to Study Instance UID (0020,000D) in DICOM and ImagingStudy.identifier in FHIR. (en)

at0093.description: *Details about images from a prior study used for comparison to the reported study. (en)

at0094.description: *The name of the comparison imaging examination performed. (en)

at0095.description: *Unique identifier for the comparison imaging study. (en)

at0096.description: *Date and time the comparison examination started. (en)

at0097.description: *Digital location of the comparison imaging content and metadata. (en)
at0097.comment: *This location identifies the network service providing access (for storage, viewing, querying, or retrieval) for the study. Equivalent to ImagingStudy.endpoint in FHIR. (en)

at0098.description: *Digital location of the imaging content and metadata. (en)
at0098.comment: *This location identifies the network service providing access (for storage, viewing, querying, or retrieval) for the study. Equivalent to ImagingStudy.endpoint in FHIR. (en)

at0099.description: *The current state of the imaging study. (en)

at0100.description: *The existence of the imaging study is registered, but there is nothing yet available. (en)

at0101.description: *At least one instance has been associated with this imaging study. (en)

at0102.description: *The imaging study is unavailable because the study was not started or not completed. (en)

at0103.description: *The status is not known by the radiology source system. (en)

at0104.description: *Unique identifier for the imaging report assigned by the radiology service. (en)
at0104.comment: *As one instance of this archetype is used per study, this identifier can be used to connect more than one imaging study within a single combined report. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.identifier in FHIR.  (en)

at0105.description: *Radiology service-generated description or classification of the study. (en)
at0105.comment: *Equivalent to ImagingStudy.description in FHIR and Study description (0008, 1030) in DICOM. Possible DICOM examples: MR BREAS, UNIT; NEURO^HEAD; or MR BREASTUNI UE. (en)

at0106.description: *Link to full details of any imaging carried out during the study. (en)
at0106.comment: *Typically referencing images used the DICOM enabled modalities, but this data field provides an alternative method to access the images. Equivalent to FHIR's DiagnosticReport.imagingStudy. (en)

at0107.description: *Identification of a stabilising appliance in use. (en)

at0108.description: *Position of the individual during the imaging examination. (en)

at0091.1.description: *The type of imaging device, process or method that originally acquired or produced the data used to create the images in the study. (en)
at0091.1.comment: *For example: 'XRay', 'CT scan', 'ultrasound', 'MRI', 'bone densitometry', 'tomography', 'mammography', 'nuclear medicine', 'PET', 'angiography', and 'fluoroscopy'. This data element may be redundant if the modality is clearly represented in the 'Study name'. Alternatively it may also be possible to autopopulate the 'Modality' from a coded 'Study name'. Coding of the 'Modality' with a value set is recommended, such as the DICOM CID 29 Acquisition Modality value set. Equivalent to ImagingStudy.modality in FHIR and Modality (0008, 0060) in DICOM. (en)

at0092.1.description: *Unique identifier for the imaging study assigned by the imaging device. (en)
at0092.1.comment: *Equivalent to Study Instance UID (0020,000D) in DICOM and ImagingStudy.identifier in FHIR. (en)

at0059.1.description: Förslag för ytterligare avbildning, undersökningar och/eller hänvisning och tillhörande motiv.
at0059.1.comment: *This data element has 0..* occurrences to allow for more than one recommendation. Formal orders for additional imaging examination, investigation should be recorded using an INSTRUCTION archetype, such as INSTRUCTION.service_request. (en)

at0014.1.description: *Narrative description of relevant clinical history that provides context for the examination and interpretation of results. (en)
at0014.1.comment: *Alternatively this data element can include an RM link to clinical information provided in the original examination request or located elsewhere within the health record. (en)

at0057.1.description: *Narrative description about the quality of the examination. (en)
at0057.1.comment: *For example: the nature of any limitations and their impact on interpretation; recommendation that the examination should be repeated; or whether an alternative method of assessment might be more appropriate. (en)

at0058.1.description: Enstaka ord, fras eller kort beskrivning som representerar ett möjligt tillstånd eller en diagnos.
at0058.1.comment: *This data element has multiple occurrences to allow for more than one differential diagnosis. Coding with a terminology such as SNOMED CT is preferred, where possible. This data element should be considered as mutually exclusive to "Imaging diagnosis", ie only either "Imaging diagnosis" or "Imaging differential diagnosis" in each instance of the archetype "Imaging examination result." (en)

at0098.1.description: *Digital location of the imaging content and metadata. (en)
at0098.1.comment: *This location identifies the network service providing access (for storage, viewing, querying, or retrieval) for the study. Equivalent to ImagingStudy.endpoint in FHIR. (en)

at0072.1.description: *The status of the imaging examination result as a whole. (en)
at0072.1.comment: *The values have been aligned with the FHIR Diagnostic report status, with the exception of 'Entered in error' which is relevant only to a messaging-oriented paradigm. Other local codes/terms can be used via the Text 'choice'. In most use cases, only one status is applicable at any time, however this data element allows multiple occurrences for the use cases where there are a variety of types of status that need to be specified, usually within a template. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.status in FHIR.  (en)

at0099.1.description: *The current state of the imaging study. (en)

at0071.1.description: *The date and/or time that ‘Overall result status’ was assigned. (en)

at0055.1.description: *Description of the simple body site or region targetted for imaging. (en)
at0055.1.comment: *If the body site is specified within the text or code for 'Study name', then this field may be redundant. Coding of 'Target body site' with a terminology, such as SNOMED CT, is desirable. Equivalent to ImagingStudy.series.bodySite in FHIR. (en)

at0093.1.description: *Details about images from a prior study used for comparison to the reported study. (en)

at0056.1.description: *Narrative description about the comparison of this examination with previous similar studies. (en)
at0056.1.comment: *Also use this data element to indicate if no comparison images and/or reports are available. Details about the images used for comparison can be recorded using the 'Comparison study details' CLUSTER, within Protocol. (en)

at0108.1.description: *Position of the individual during the imaging examination. (en)

at0105.1.description: *Radiology service-generated description or classification of the study. (en)
at0105.1.comment: *Equivalent to ImagingStudy.description in FHIR and Study description (0008, 1030) in DICOM. Possible DICOM examples: MR BREAS, UNIT; NEURO^HEAD; or MR BREASTUNI UE. (en)

at0106.1.description: *Link to full details of any imaging carried out during the study. (en)
at0106.1.comment: *Typically referencing images used the DICOM enabled modalities, but this data field provides an alternative method to access the images. Equivalent to FHIR's DiagnosticReport.imagingStudy. (en)

at0104.1.description: *Unique identifier for the imaging report assigned by the radiology service. (en)
at0104.1.comment: *As one instance of this archetype is used per study, this identifier can be used to connect more than one imaging study within a single combined report. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.identifier in FHIR.  (en)

at0002.1.description: Förinställd, ospecificerad tidpunkt eller tidsintervall som kan definieras mer uttryckligen i en mall (template) eller i en applikation.

at0048.1.description: Beskrivning av faktorer som inte registrerats någon annanstans, men som kan påverka fynden och/eller undersökningsresultatet.

at0049.1.description: *Narrative description about the radiological procedure used to capture the study. (en)
at0049.1.comment: *Use this data element to describe a summary of technique, including technical limitations or deviation from the normal technical procedures. For example: '5 mm axial images from the lung bases through the pubic symphysis were acquired following the administration of intravenous and oral contrast. Coronal and Sagittal reformatted images were constructed from the source data.' (en)

at0004.1.description: *The name of the imaging examination performed. (en)
at0004.1.comment: *For example: 'CT abdomen'; 'Doppler ultrasound of renal artery' or 'Plain chest xray'. Coding with a terminology is strongly recommended, preferably a term specifying both modality and anatomical location, where possible. Examples of candidate terminologies are the LOINC Imaging Document Codes, RadLex Playbook or SNOMED-CT. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.code in FHIR. (en)

at0027.1.description: *Details about a single imaging examination requested. (en)

at0006.1.description: *Structured detail about the body site or region targetted for imaging. (en)
at0006.1.comment: *If the body site is specified within the text or code for 'Study name', then this field may be redundant. (en)

at0008.1.description: *Narrative description or overview of all clinical findings. (en)

at0063.1.description: *Assessment about the quality of the examination. (en)
at0063.1.comment:
*Coding of the imaging quality with a value set is recommended. For example: 'excellent, good, fair, poor, and non-diagnostic'; or 'adequate, suboptimal and inadequate'.
 (en)

at0087.1.description: *Name of the radiological procedure used to capture the study. (en)
at0087.1.comment: *Coding of the 'Technique' with a terminology is permitted. Multiple occurrences allow for identification of one or more techniques. (en)

at0062.1.description: *Narrative description about the clinical procedure or other clinical considerations used to capture the study. (en)
at0062.1.comment: *Use this data element to describe a summary of the clinical procedure, patient positioning, interventions such as Valsalva manoeuvre, and administration of contrast agent, radiopharmaceuticals and/or treatments as part of the imaging study. For example: '80 ml of Isovue-370 was administered intravenously using a bolus-tracking technique centered on the main pulmonary artery'. It can also be used to record an overview of any issues, complications or adverse reactions encountered.  (en)

at0061.1.description: *Narrative description about the reason the examination was originally requested. (en)

at0088.1.description: *Identification of the clinical procedure or management used to capture the study. (en)

at0021.1.description: Kortfattad och kliniskt relevant tolkning av alla bilddiagnostiska fynd, inklusive en jämförelse med tidigare studier där så är lämpligt.
at0021.1.comment: *Also referred to as 'Opinion' or 'Conclusion'. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.conclusion in FHIR. (en)

at0020.1.description: Enstaka ord, fras eller kort beskrivning som representerar det troliga tillståndet eller diagnosen.
at0020.1.comment: *This data element has multiple occurrences to allow for more than one differential diagnosis. Coding with a terminology such as SNOMED CT is preferred, where possible. This data element should be considered as mutually exclusive to "Imaging differential diagnosis", ie only either "Imaging diagnosis" or "Imaging differential diagnosis" in each instance of the archetype "Imaging examination result." Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.conclusionCode in FHIR. (en)

at0023.1.description: Ytterligare beskrivning av undersökningen som inte fångats i andra fält.
at0023.1.comment: *For example: a note that the film was given to the patient. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.note in FHIR. (en)
